subject: Self Care
title: The Grayscale Trick
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Grayscale Trick.

hook.text: Switch your phone to grayscale and suddenly it becomes boring. Colors are designed to attract you. Remove them.

buildup.text: Color triggers emotional responses. App designers use red badges and bright icons specifically to demand your attention.

discovery.text: Former Google ethicist Tristan Harris recommends grayscale as the single most effective phone habit intervention.

twist.text: Your phone becomes a tool instead of a toy. You use it purposefully because it's no longer visually rewarding.

climax.text: Try grayscale for one week. Set it in accessibility settings. Notice how much less you reach for your phone.

punchline.text: Go grayscale. A boring phone is a less addictive phone.

quiz.question: Why does switching to grayscale reduce phone addiction?
options: Removing color removes the visual rewards that trigger compulsive checking
Grayscale has no effect on usage
